name: Days Inn of Taos

reviews.text: Rooms were clean, bed fairly comfortable. The walls are thin and poorly insulated so be prepared to hear the noise of slamming doors, water running and voices all the time in your room. The showers worked well and looked like they were recently renovated. The continental breakfast is minimalistic. The cleanliness was what impressed me most (otherwise I would give two stars), the noise the great drawback. It is pet friendly, and has decent wireless internet. Overall, ok for a budget hotel.
reviews.title: OK Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, these people LIE. When I made our reservation by phone, I asked (as I always do) if there was construction going on at the hotel. The clerk told me no, and assured me he would look out for us by finding a good room in the back. When I arrived, I saw workers doing construction right outside our window! I checked out and was given my money back politely and with an apology by the woman clerk. But where were me and my wife going to spend the night? Where would we go? By lying to me, these people had cost me a day's time- and it was now Friday at 4 pm, not exactly a great time to find a room.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Feeling a bit panicy, I sat in the lobby looking at tripadvisor.com so I could find another room. A man in his mid-40s, who I imagine is the manager, comes up to me and my wife and tells us if we don't want to stay at his hotel, we should get out! I told him it wasn't our fault, the clerk had told us there was no construction and there was. I said I'm just trying to find another place to stay. Again, he told me to get out. I said fine, if you want to kick me out, I'll leave- and tell everyone on tripadvisor.com how we've been lied to and shabbily treated. He started screaming and we left. Never have I been treated this way- and all the worse in front of my wife! She now says our vacation was ruined by this man, and I agree. I will never go back to this hotel, and neither should you.
reviews.title: Okay place to stay

reviews.text: I wrote a review on this one a few years ago, but have just had a recent stay. I believe this one is under different ownership than my previous visits. The lobby had a bit of an "odor" to it, as did the hallway going to the room. However, the room itself did not. The room was clean and comfortable (although the bathroom was small). Did not partake of their continental breakfast, but by the smell, someone had burned something pretty badly (owners? guests?) For the price we paid, would recommend staying here (however, most likely I probably will check into other lodging the next time I am in the area.) Note: many of the shops in the plaza were not open until 10:00 am or after. So if you are planning on an earlier shopping trip, you might keep that in mind.
reviews.title: This hotel deserves good rating! Family owned...

likes.liked: — The bed was MORE than average, and much less quality than any 3 Star hotels I've stayed in.
likes.disliked: — The towels were small and rough...

reviews.text: I'm writing this review because my friend and I were at this hotel and were VERY pleased with the service, the cleanliness, the location and the value. I never give ANYPLACE a 5 star rating, because I've been to a perfect hotel. But this Days Inn is an easy 4 star for it's price, in ratio to what you get and to the service.
reviews.title: Not worth the price!

reviews.text: Overall, I liked this place. The room was clean and in good condition. The king size bed was very comfortable. I did't hear any plumbing noise coming from the other rooms. As in any hotel, you will hear doors slamming because of inconsiderate guests. If you are going to use the free wireless internet, get a room near the office, as the only transmitter is located there. My room was all the way in the back and I hardly had a signal sometimes (keep in mind however, that rooms near the front will get more road noise from the highway). The air conditioner/heater filter in my room looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a year. I rinsed it out in the bathtub and all was fine. The breakfast was pretty lame, but at least it was available until 10 a.m. Two icky-sweet cereals, packaged pastries, and bread with a toaster were the choices. Some fresh fruit and maybe instant oatmeal would have been more welcome for me. I got a $43 per night rate on the internet, so it was overall a good value. I would probably stay there again if the price were the same.
reviews.title: A nice budget hotel

likes.liked: — Nice clean room (except for air conditioner filter)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having traveled through out the Southwest, I'm no stranger to the Taos and Santa Fe, area. There was a time when this place was a bargain, especially in "off season". Well, my little chickadees, first and foremost when driving into town, get the room first. don't wait until after 8:00pm and find a no vacancy sign. One night, I find that not only this Inn, is under new ownership, Prices for their rooms have shot up. Sure AAA and ARRP offer minimal discounts but in Taos look around you'll find a better deal.
reviews.title: What Happened?

reviews.text: This is a GREAT place to stay after a long drive from anywhere to beautiful Taos. The staff is knowledgeable about places to eat and places to go and the rooms are well kept and CLEAN. You can't go wrong with this place. And the price ($47) works also. With that, and a free continental breakfast, you can't go wrong!
reviews.title: Great place in Taos

reviews.text: Please understand before I write this that while my "excellent" rating for this hotel contrasts with my "Okay but some problems" rating for The Mirage in Las Vegas it is because to me and my family value and cleanliness far outdistance glitz and glamour. This hotel has large rooms with air conditioners and heaters that are noiseless and functional and a television that is both large and commands well over 60 crisp and clear channels. The hotel internet is superb and lightening fast for those of us that never really get a vacation away from work. Okay the towels and wash cloths are not Vegas quality but they are plentiful and the bathrooms are exceptionally clean. The manager and his family live on site and are always available to help with any question. Coffee is kept hot 24-hours a day in the lobby and even the windows open for fresh air ventilation if you decide to have a smoke in your room. Angel Fire and Taso ski facilities are about 10 miles away and every conceivable restaurant and shopping opportunity is within a five minute drive. The value here (I paid $45/Night) is exceptional and the quality is well above most every other hotel in town.
reviews.title: Excellent Value / Outstanding Internet

reviews.text: In a nutshell all I've got to say is if you have to stay here, call them first and ask alot of questions. Ask them if they have any specials, their breakfast(Ha Ha), and the quality of their rooms (Another Ha Ha). I paid $78 through orbitz and I've got alot more for alot less from classer places. Trust me when I say shell out the extra 20,30,40 dollars for a nicer place. It's not a total dump don't get me wrong, but if you want your moneys worth stay somewhere else. Oh yea buy the way me and my wife both did'nt get a good nites sleep, I'd swear they took a piece of plywood and threw a sheet over it to make it look like a bed......NO JOKE that was the second worst bed I've ever slept on, the first was at a cabin in South West Oklahoma, but days inn was pretty close!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Think before you act!!!!

reviews.text: No problems at this motel, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Good inexpensive motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you just need a clean place to crash at the end of each day with a light breakfast to hold you over the next morning, this place for you. The gentleman running the hotel when we were there was very helpful. We did not have hot water the first night, but it was fixed by the next night. This hotel was very quiet even though it seemed to be close to capacity.
reviews.title: Clean, Cheap, Close to Taos

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and very fairly priced with my AAA card.
reviews.title: Clean hotel-nothing else

reviews.text: However, the "continental breakfast" was stale toast and apple juice. And, when I checked out the next morning my car had handprints on two handles and the trunk. Nothing was missing nor did it appear that anyone had entered the vehicle...still disturbing. Maybe double check that your doors are locked.
reviews.title: WiFi doesn't work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The WiFi seldom worked & only worked for a minute or two at a time. The motel printer didn't work so we couldn't get a receipt. The breakfast was good, but they only had whole milk, no skim milk. The rooms & breakfast area were clean. The motel was quite, no barking dogs (wonderful). No fridge or microwave.
reviews.title: We will stay again

reviews.text: When we drove up to the hotel, if you want to call it that, there were no lights on at all and it didnt even look like it was open. Whoever was on duty must have been sleeping or something because when we went to open the door to go inside he turned on the lights in the check in area. We checked in and went to our rooms, the room was VERY cold when we entered and from working in the hospitality industry previously I checked out the room. In the bed when I pulled back the sheets I found LOTS of hair, yes it looked like pubic hair all over the sheets along with a clipped toe nail. I went and got new sheets from the front desk, and he did not even offer to come change them or have someone come change them for me. The sheets were not wrapped in plastic like they should have been to keep them clean. So I went back to the room and changed the sheets myself, this set was also covered in long black hairs. Instead of going back to the front desk to get more I just shook them off and put them on the bed anyway because my family and I were exhausted from a day of traveling. The king size bed was very hard and made for a very uncomfortable night of sleep. The breakfast was worthless and there was not even any milk for the cereal that they provided. This may be a cheaper hotel...but here you sure get what you pay for....NOTHING!! I would NOT suggest that anyone stay there, especially with children. No one working there seemed friendly and I noticed that the housekeeper on duty was not even in a uniform, she had on jeans and a sweatshirt; that is not good for security purposes.
reviews.title: Awful stay! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had fleas in our room and the manager would not give us another room or our money back. We had to drive 2 hours to find an available room.
reviews.title: Stay away from this hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When traveling from Denver to Albuquerque, we stopped at the Days Inn in Taos for the night. The room was very clean. I have been in some yukky rooms, and so I really appreciate clean rooms. Room price midweek in Aug. was $55/night. (Super 8 next door was $76) Good value.
reviews.title: Very clean/good value

reviews.text: My brother and I were driving across country so we simply needed a convenient place to sleep and rest. This was a no-frills kind of motel but it was inexpensive and clean.
reviews.title: No-frills but driving distance to Taos highlights.

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Affordable and clean in Toas

aka: Days Inn Of Taos Hotel Taos
